topic.title: Outputs of DITA Documentation
topic.shortdesc: DITA is specifically designed for multi-channel publishing, meaning you can create content once and publish it to many formats without rewriting or reformatting the source.

body.p: The publishing output is decoupled from the content, so your writing remains consistent regardless of the target format. Common Output Formats: • HTML: Ideal for online help systems, knowledge bases, and intranets. • PDF: Suitable for printed manuals, regulatory documentation, and offline usage. • ePub / Mobile / WebApps: Used for mobile-friendly user guides and dynamic content portals. • Content Delivery Platforms (CDPs): Dynamic portals that allow personalized, filterable content based on metadata and user roles. Tools for Publishing: • DITA Open Toolkit (DITA-OT): The standard open-source publishing engine. It transforms DITA XML into various output formats. • Commercial tools: Many commercial tools integrate DITA-OT or provide their own publishing engines, such as Oxygen XML Editor, SDL Tridion Docs, Adobe Experience Manager, Fluid Topics, and Zoomin.
